intro: Spermacoce psyllioides, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Spermacoce psyllioides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
